conclusion: The problem involves determining the temperature of the gas in tube A when the liquid levels in both tubes are equal, given specific dimensions and conditions of the U-shaped tube.
The volume of gas in tube A can be calculated using the formula for the volume of a cylinder: V = S * h, where S is the cross-sectional area and h is the height of the gas column.
The volume of gas in tube A is expressed as V_A = S_A * h_A.
The volume of gas in tube B is given as 3 times the volume of gas in tube A, so V_B = 3 * V_A = 3 * S_A * h_A.
The height of the gas column in tube B is given as h_B = h_2 = 12 cm.
Using the formula for the volume of a cylinder, the volume of gas in tube B is calculated as V_B = S_B * h_B = 3S_A * h_A = 3 * 3S_A * h_A = 9S_A * h_A.

The temperature of the gas in tube A can be determined by comparing the volume of gas in tube A to the volume of gas in tube B. Since the volume of gas in tube B is 9 times the volume of gas in tube A, the temperature of the gas in tube A will be 1/9th of the temperature of the gas in tube B.
The temperature of the gas in tube B is given as T_B = 27°C.
The temperature of the gas in tube A when the liquid levels in both tubes are equal is calculated as T_A = T_B / 9 = 27°C / 9 = 3°C.
